definition[0]: a period of time when a soldier or someone working in another country can return to their own country
example[0]: a young soldier home on furlough
definition[1]: a period of time when workers are told not to work, especially because there is not enough money to pay them
example[1]: workers forced to take a long, unpaid furlough
definition[2]: a short period of time during which a prisoner is allowed to leave prison before returning
example[2]: Morton stabbed the man while on furlough.
